intro: Leonocassia stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf leonocassia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pale green to yellow in color. It is often found in moist, shady environments such as forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
